H0.text: Catching food is the way the needle shape of cactus leaves helps the plant survive.

H1.text: Preventing water loss is how the needle shape of a cactus plant’s leaves helps the plant survive.

H2.text: Staying in place helps a cactus plant survive, since its needles—actually leaves—are shaped to stay in place.

H3.text: Reproducing is how a cactus plant survives with its needle-shaped leaves.

A4.text: Spines help prevent water loss by reducing air flow close to the cactus and providing some shade.

A5.text: They trap air near the surface of the cactus, creating a moister layer that reduces evaporation and transpiration.
